summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) regarding travel approval requests for prosecutors and staff to conduct victim interviews and meetings in West Palm Beach, Florida, and Los Angeles as part of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein (case 2018R01618). The emails span from March to October 2019 and detail logistical planning for interviews.

persons.name: Darlene Alleyne
persons.context: Coordinates travel reservations (airfare and hotel) for SDNY personnel traveling for the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: The recipient of multiple travel approval requests; grants approval for travel and conference room reservations for the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: Copied on travel approval request emails related to the Epstein investigation.

connections.description: Both are SDNY personnel copied on internal emails regarding travel for the Epstein investigation.
Tyrrell is the approving official for travel requests that Alleyne helps coordinate and book.
Both are SDNY staff copied on the same internal travel coordination emails.

events.title: Planned Interview in West Palm Beach
events.description: SDNY prosecutors plan to travel to West Palm Beach, FL, to conduct an interview, requesting a hotel conference room for the purpose.

events.title: Planned Victim Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: SDNY prosecutors request travel to Los Angeles for a victim interview, planning to use a hotel conference room.

events.title: Planned Meetings/Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: SDNY prosecutors request travel to West Palm Beach, FL, for approximately three days for meetings and interviews with victims.

events.title: Initial Travel Request for Epstein Investigation
events.description: SDNY prosecutors formally request travel to West Palm Beach/Fort Lauderdale, Florida, for meetings and interviews related to United States v. Epstein.

locations: Southern District of New York (SDNY) U.S. Attorney's Office
keyFacts: The SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein is referenced by case number 2018R01618, titled 'United States v. Epstein, an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity.'
Prosecutors traveled multiple times in 2019 to West Palm Beach, FL, and Los Angeles, CA, to conduct victim interviews, indicating an active investigative phase.
The emails show a pattern of securing hotel conference rooms for conducting interviews during travel.
The correspondence reveals internal SDNY procedures for obtaining supervisory approval (from Edward Tyrrell) for investigative travel.
The travel requests involve multiple unnamed prosecutors/assistants (redacted or referred to as 'me', 'we', 'M', etc.) working on the case alongside the named staff.
